result.execSummary:
The defendant Alashonza M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. JM
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) gj

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in custody.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 76 days at the House of Correction with 76 days credit.
The court found that the defendant is indigent and WAIVED all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  
Jury trial date vacated.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Alashonza M Johnson not in court, in custody.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab

The defendant's appearance was waived for today's date.
The defendant has a homicide case pending in Illinois, which he has waived extradition.
Court ordered case calendered for a jury trial in Branch 36.
  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Alashonza M Johnson not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense informs the court that he has received an offer and discovery and is asking for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Lamke contacted court requesting to reschedule 11-23-2015 date.  Scheduling conference now scheduled for 11-18-2015 1:30 pm in Branch 36.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions set by the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare or Children's Court regarding contact/visitation with her child.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 50.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions set by the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare or Children's Court regarding contact/visitation with her child.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
DUPLICATE FILE IN COURT.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Bail/Bond Hearing to be heard by Judge Dallet for Judge Kremers.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson not in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
A bench warrant was issued on 09/11/2015. There were no appearances from the defense today.
Bench warrant remains in effect.
No action taken.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to report for booking and release, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Court ordered the defendant to comply with all terms and conditions set by the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare or Children's Court regarding contact/visitation with her child.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON 9/11/15. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Alashonza M Johnson in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 09-10-2015 at 01:30pm
